question: Which of the following was the only Hindu convert to sit on the throne of Delhi?
explanation: Nasiruddin Khusrau Shah ruled from 1320 to 1321. Ghazi Malik, the governor of Dipalpur, killed Khusru Shah and ascended the throne of Delhi. He took up the title of Ghiyasuddin Tughlaq in c.1320 CE. Khusrau Shah was the only Hindu convert to sit on the throne of Delhi.
